features: 0.5-ounce tube of Neosporin + Lidocaine Pain Relieving Antibiotic Ointment for first aid wound care of minor cuts, scrapes, and burns
Topical antibiotic ointment provides 24-hour infection protection of minor wounds and helps to reduce pain with maximum-strength, fast-acting lidocaine to numb the area

Contains bacitracin zinc, neomycin sulfate and polymyxin B sulfate antibiotics to help prevent wound infection of minor cuts, scrapes, and burns and fast-acting lidocaine as an external analgesic for maximum-strength numbing and pain relief

The antibiotic ointment from the #1 doctor recommended brand not only helps fight infection for 24 hours, but also numbs away the pain, making it a great addition to your first-aid kit and wound care supplies
For best results, clean the affected area, apply a small amount of the topical antibiotic and pain relief numbing ointment 1 to 3 times daily, and cover with a sterile bandage
body.description: Care for minor cuts, scrapes, and burns with Neosporin + Lidocaine Topical Pain Relieving Antibiotic Ointment. This antibiotic ointment from a doctor-recommended brand contains bacitracin zinc, neomycin sulfate, and polymyxin B sulfate antibiotics to provide 24-hour protection against infection of minor wounds, cuts, scrapes, and burns. The topical first aid ointment also contains fast-acting lidocaine, an external analgesic, for maximum-strength numbing and pain relief. A great addition to your home first-aid kit and wound care supplies, the pain relieving topical antibiotic ointment can be applied to the affected area 1-3 times daily. For best results, cover the wound with a sterile bandage after application.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: About US NEOSPORIN is typically used to treat skin infections and protect wounds from potential infection. NEOSPORIN products treat minor wounds such as scrapes, cuts and light burns. Products are also available to help minimize the appearance of scars, soothe pain and heal chapped lips. How To Use NEOSPORIN: Check the expiration date. Do not use expired productAlways follow the instructions on the label1Wash your hands before and after using NEOSPORINApply a thin layer of your chosen NEOSPORIN to the affected area1 1 to 3 times dailyKeep out of reach of children

NEOSPORIN - Lidocaine First Aid Antibiotic Ointment

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact and Effective Product with Unique Temperature Sensitivity
reviews.reviewText: TL;DR: Tube size is appropriate for the price, benefits from temperature adjustment, product delivers as promised.Regarding this product, the tube's size is a common topic in reviews, but I found it to be as described and satisfactory for its price. A unique aspect is its sensitivity to temperature. When it arrived during the warmer months, the contents were somewhat fluid. However, allowing it to settle at room temperature or placing it in the refrigerator briefly helps it regain the right consistency. This characteristic doesn't detract from the product's quality; it's just a factor to consider during delivery and storage.The tube is compact and convenient, similar in size to everyday personal care items, making it easy to handle and use. Despite its petite appearance, the product is quite effective. Sharing such nuances in reviews is important to provide a comprehensive understanding of the product's performance and characteristics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this neosporin with the extra pain relief. It really does help!! It’s not a very big tube but I discovered if you cut the bottom off there is actually a lot left in it and you can scrape it out with your finger or a q-tip. I have bought this product many times because I’m so happy with it!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pain Relief a big plus
reviews.reviewText: Great for those little boo boos that life throws your way. The addition of pain relief is a bonus, and takes the sting away from your injury. This size tube is great - I have them in the various first aid kits in the house/car/backpack and since we have several I don't need a great big tube that will go bad before its used up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It worked perfectly

reviews.reviewText: The product's expiry dated 07/2024. I was expecting at lease 12-18 months not 6 months.
